attributes.comment:
I have a brother and sister-in-law that are currently undergoing the paperwork, fees
and home studies so that they can adopt a baby from China. This has been a
huge process for them. They have four children and are not "rich". To qualify to
adopt a baby from China they have both had to take on extra jobs to earn enough
to have the minimum financial requirements. I have no doubt that they will be
wonderful parents and give this baby a loving home.

However, in raising the fees necessary for adoption you are further pressuring a
family that is already making a selfless sacrifice. Can't our agency representing
and assisting potential adoptive parents look at other avenues of getting more
monies rather than taxing the financially burdened parents? How much more do
you want out of parents already sacrificing so much?

Thanks for your time,
Nadine E. Lovell



Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Nadine E. Lovell
